title: Public transport for Run For The Kids: Sunday 19 March 2023
articleContent:
Public transport for Run For The Kids: Sunday 19 March 2023

There are a number of additional services and public transport service changes in place for Run For The Kids on Sunday 19 March.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Forward service to Southern Cross Station:

Please note: all arrival times are for Southern Cross Station.

  • Camberwell at 7:14am and 8:25am, arriving at 7.30am and 8.41am
  • Glen Waverley at 6:27am and 8:18am, arriving at 7:02am and 8:53am
  • Heidelberg at 7:06am and 8:21am, arriving at 7:37am and 8:53am
  • Mernda at 6:16am and 8:02am, arriving at 7:13am and 9:00am
  • Pakenham at 6:07am and 7:27am, arriving at 7:22am and 8:42am
  • Frankston at 6am and 7:48am, arriving at 7:13am and 9:00am
  • Sandringham at 6:43am and 8am, arriving at 7:22am and 8:36am
  • Werribee at 6:33am and 8am, arriving at 7:11am and 8:41am 
  • Craigieburn at 6:38am and 8:05am, arriving at 7:20am and 8:49am
  • Upfield at 6:52am and 8:17am, arriving at 7:22am and 8:47am

For customers travelling on additional services on the Mernda, Hurstbridge, Belgrave, Lilydale, Glen Waverley, Frankston and Sandringham lines, please remain onboard at Flinders Street as services will continue to Southern Cross Station to get you to the Start Line on Harbour Esplanade.

There will be changes and replacement buses for part of the journey on the following lines. Passengers are advised to check the disruptions articles for further information:

  • Belgrave and Lilydale lines – Replacement Buses
  • Hurstbridge Line – Replacement Buses
  • Sunbury Line – Replacement Buses
  • Upfield Line – Replacement Buses
  • Belgrave, Lilydale and Glen Waverley lines – No Loop services, direct to Flinders Street
  • Craigieburn, Upfield and Sunbury – No Loop services, direct to Flinders Street

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to Docklands

Due to road closures for Run for the Kids, there will be tram service changes.

Trams on Routes 11, 12, 30, 35, 48, 58, 70, 75, 86, 96 and 109 will experience temporary service changes from first service until 6pm.

Route 11

  • From first tram to 6pm, Route 11 services will run between Stop 47 West Preston/Gilbert Road and Stop 1 Spencer Street/Collins Street.

Route 12

  • From first tram until 1.30pm, Route 12 services will run in two sections: between Stop 143 Fitzroy Street/Park Street and Stop 124 Batman Park/Spencer Street, and between Stop 25 River Boulevard/Victoria Street and Stop 1 Spencer Street/Collins Street.

Routes 30 and 35 (City Circle)

  • No trams will operate from first tram until 6pm.

Route 48

  • From first tram until 6pm, Route 48 services will run a shortened service between Stop 51 Balwyn Road/Doncaster Road and Stop 1 Spencer Street/Collins Street.

Route 58

  • From first tram to 1.30pm, Route 58 services will run in two sections: between Stop 45 Bell Street/Melville Road and Stop 4 Collins Street/William Street, and between Stop 139 Glenferrie Road/Toorak Road and Stop 116 City Road/Kings Way.

Routes 70 and 75

  • From first tram until 1.30pm, Route 70 services will run between Stop 61 Elgar Road and Stop 2 Melbourne Aquarium.
  • From 1.30pm until 6pm, Route 70 services will run between Stop 61 Elgar Road and Stop D6 Flinders Street West.

Route 86

  • From 2am until 6pm, Route 86 services will run between Stop 71 McKimmies Road/Plenty Road and Stop 1 Southern Cross Station/Spencer Street.

Route 96

  • From 5.30am to 1.30pm, Route 96 services will run in two sections: between Stop 139 Acland Street and Stop 124 Batman Park, and between Stop 23 Blyth Street and Stop 1 Southern Cross Station.

Route 109

  • From 5.30am to 1.30pm, Route 109 services will run in two sections: between Stop 58 Box Hill Central/Whitehorse Road and Stop 1 Spencer Street/Collins Street, and between Stop 129 Beacon Cove/Light Rail and Stop 124 Batman Park/Spencer Street.

Stop closures

  • Stop D1 Stadium Precinct/La Trobe Street
  • Stop D2 Central Pier/Harbour Esplanade
  • Stop D3 Stadium Precinct/Bourke Street
  • Stop D4 Docklands Park/Harbour Esplanade
  • Stop D5 The Goods Shed/McCrae Street
  • Stop D6 Flinders Street West/Flinders Street
  • Stop D10 New Quay/Docklands Drive
  • Stop D11 Waterfront City Docklands
  • Stop D14 Southern Cross Station
  • Stop D15 Batman's Hill
  • Stop D16 Harbour Esplanade/Collins Street
  • D17 Collins Landing
  • D18 Victoria Harbour Docklands
  • Stop 119 Spencer Street/La Trobe Street
  • Stop 122 Southern Cross Station/Collins Street
  • Stop 124 Batman Park/Flinders Street (towards City)
  • Stop 1 Spencer Street/Flinders Street
  • Stop 1 Flinders Street/Queensbridge Street
  • Stop 115 Casino/Southbank
  • Stop 116 City Road/Kings Way (to City)

View more information on tram service changes here.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

The following bus routes will be impacted by service changes for the duration of the event, including bus diversions and stop closures:

  • Route 216
  • Route 220
  • Route 232
  • Route 234
  • Route 235
  • Route 605

View information about service changes and stop closures on Routes 216, 220, 232, 234 and 235 here.

View information about service changes and stop closures on Route 605 here.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Getting to Docklands

Normal services arrive and depart from Southern Cross Station.

Coaches will replace trains for all or part of the journey on the following lines to/from Southern Cross Station, and passengers are advised to check the disruption articles for further information:

  • Seymour Line
  • Shepparton Line
  • Bendigo and Echuca lines
  • Swan Hill Line
  • Ararat, Ballarat and Maryborough lines
  • Geelong Line
  • Warrnambool Line

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for Run For The Kids: Sunday 19 March 2023
